title.narrative: CF AND GENDER-RESPONSIVE JUSTICE

description.narrative: Judicial staff and other professionals are qualified to promote and apply child-friendly and gender-responsive justice for all boys and girls, including restorative justice principles for girls and boys in conflict with the law

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Judicial staff and other professionals are qualified to promote and apply child-friendly and gender-responsive justice for all boys and girls, including restorative justice principles for girls and boys in conflict with the law

description.narrative: Equitable access to justice for all children was included in the Justice Reform Strategy for Montenegro - thus anchoring it in the national rule of law and sustainable development agenda. Capacities of policy-makers and professionals on child-friendly justice and equitable access to justice for children were strengthened. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of support persons to the child and professionals in Professional Support Services who are equipped with specialized knowledge necessary to support child friendly proceedings

Percentage of judicial staff who work with cases involving children qualified to promote and apply child friendly and gender sensitive justice for all children including restorative justice principles for girls and boys in conflict with the law
Number of municipalities with Child Friendly Spaces for child friendly hearing

actual.value: 2019:In cooperation with the Ministry of Justice, the Supreme Court and the Supreme State Prosecutor`s Office of Montenegro, a number of courts and prosecutors' offices have been identified where child-friendly spaces will be modelled in Montenegro`s judiciary in 2020.

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems
